definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: The thirsty wayfarer was glad to find a fresh spring near the road.
sentences.chinese: 口渴的徒步旅行者很高兴在路边找到新鲜的泉水。

sentences.english: cold waters to a thirsty soul, so [is] good news from a far country.
sentences.chinese: 有好消息从远方来，就如拿凉水给口渴的人喝。

sentences.english: The old saying goes, ‘Dig your well before you’re thirsty.’
sentences.chinese: 像谚语说的，“在口渴之前挖井”。

sentences.english: The thirsty man craved for water.
sentences.chinese: 那个口渴的人渴望喝水。

sentences.english: I often feel thirsty when it's very hot.
Drink much more than that and the caffeine can dehydrate you or raise your blood pressure.
sentences.chinese: 而喝得太多，咖啡因会导致你口渴或者升高你的血压。

sentences.english: When you come back, my mother and I are thirsty, also did not sell outside of water.
sentences.chinese: 回来的时侯，我和妈妈都口渴了，外面也没有卖水的。

sentences.english: Also always bring plenty of water, as kids are always thirsty.
sentences.chinese: 另外，经常要带足够的水，因为孩子们总是口渴。

sentences.english: But they were thirsty and had only a few dates to eat.
sentences.chinese: 但他们口渴了，并且只要几颗蜜枣果腹。

sentences.english: The boiling sun made us thirsty.
sentences.chinese: 炎热的太阳让我们口渴。
不疼，可是我总感到口渴。

sentences.english: The problem is, I\'m not sure I always drink when I\'m thirsty.
sentences.chinese: 问题是，我不敢肯定我总是会在当我口渴的时候喝水。

sentences.english: They suffer from thirst first and always.
sentences.chinese: 由于他们总是饱尝口渴的折磨。

sentences.english: The firm fireman first overcame thirst desire.
sentences.chinese: 坚定的消防员首先克服口渴欲望。

sentences.english: And let him that is athirst come.
Those thirsty people eagerly drank up the soup.

definition: lit. dry mouth and tongue (idiom); to talk too much
